intro: Clarionea ciliaris, commonly known as the silverleaf daisy, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It is characterized by its silvery, fuzzy leaves and bright yellow flowers that bloom in spring. The plant typically grows in well-drained soils and prefers full sun exposure. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes. Clarionea ciliaris is a member of the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers.
